means: 将（某物）切开（或分割）
削减
剪切
切成
删剪
电影
（为决定谁先出牌等）切牌
可被切割
可用于切割
切口
削减
剪裁
切片
[地名] [美国] 卡特
Central Unica dos Trabalhadores （葡萄牙语）<巴基斯坦>总工会
circuit under test 被测电路
control unit tester 控制部件测试仪
California United Terminal 加利福尼亚联合总站

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"切，砍"之意。
means: chop ： 指用刀斧连续猛力砍某物，以便砍断、切碎。
cut ： 普通用词，使用广泛。指用带刃工具的切、割、砍等的行动。
hack ： 指粗暴地乱剪、乱砍、乱劈。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"缩短"之意。
means: shorten ： 通常指缩短时间、尺寸或过程。
abbreviate ： 指省去应有的或后续的部分，从而使整体缩短。也可指缩短时间。
abridge ： 多指对书籍的删节或缩短，删去不重要部分而保存其精华。
cut ： 普通用词，指任何缩短而缩减的过程。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"伤口，损伤"之意。
means: wound ： 通常指尖锐锋利的工具所致的伤口，多深及到表皮组织以下。可用作引申指打击或伤害。
bruise ： 指表皮下面的组织受损，但没有破裂。但由于血流进组织，因而出现紫块。普通用词。
cut ： 指因尖利的器械的刺或割而造成的或深或浅的伤口。
scar ： 主要指伤口愈合而留下的伤疤。

word_mean: cut-off low 向低纬方向移动而脱离基本西风气流的冷低压。
介于两种名义粒度界限内的粉末的粒度等级。
台阶上按顺序开采的条带。

sentence.Network_en: Early American weathervanes were most often cut from flat wooden boards.
sentence.Network_cn: 美国早期的风向标大多截自平直的木板。

sentence.Network_en: When she had attempted to cut his nails he resisted.
sentence.Network_cn: 她试图给他剪指甲，他不让。

sentence.Network_en: Serve the cake warm or at room temperature, cut in squares.
sentence.Network_cn: 等蛋糕温热或凉至室温时切成四方块端上桌。

大学英语四级常用词组 ... cut off 切掉；切断；阻隔 cut out 切掉；删掉；停止 cut through (抄近路)穿过；穿透.

phrase.cizu_name: be cut out for (或 to be)

jx.jx_en_mean: [usu. with negative](informal)have exactly the right qualities for a particular role, task, or job

lj.lj_ly: I'm just not cut out to be a policeman.
she's a cut above the rest.

jx.jx_en_mean: [often with negative](of a situation) completely settled or decided

lj.lj_ly: the championship is not as cut and dried as everyone thinks.
lj.lj_ls: 冠军归属不像人们所想的已成定局。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)make a speedy or sudden departure from an awkward or hazardous situation rather than deal with it
a spirited and rapid interchange of views

lj.lj_ly: the cut and thrust of political debate.

jx.jx_en_mean: (of a point or statement) serve both sides of an argument
take the shortest course by going across and not around a corner
[often in imperative](vulgar slang)get to the point; state the real situation
be stylish or impressive in one's dress or behaviour
jx.jx_cn_mean: （衣着或行为上）出风头；引人注目
无视某人存在，不屑一顾

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly N. Amer.)come to an arrangement, especially in business; make a deal
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主北美)（尤指商业上）达成协议，做生意
(非正式)戳破（某人）自吹自擂，让（某人）识趣

jx.jx_en_mean: reduce the size or power of something, for example an organization, which is regarded as having become too large or powerful
jx.jx_cn_mean: 精简；削减（某物，如某组织）的势力

jx.jx_en_mean: present oneself or appear in a particular way

lj.lj_ly: David has cut a dashing figure on the international social scene.
lj.lj_ls: 在国际社交场合戴维已经崭露头角。

means.word_mean: 切;割;削;砍
削减;缩短
其他释义
切;割;剪;削;砍
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (probably existing, although not recorded, in Old English); probably of Germanic origin and related to Norwegian kutte and Icelandic kuta 'cut with a small knife', kuti 'small blunt knife'

entry.def: If you cut something, you use a knife or a similar tool to divide it into pieces, or to mark it or damage it. If you cut a shape or a hole in something, you make the shape or hole by using a knife or similar tool.

example.ex: Mrs. Haines stood nearby, holding scissors to cut a ribbon...
example.tran: 海恩斯夫人站在旁边，手持剪刀准备剪彩。

example.ex: Cut the tomatoes in half vertically...
example.tran: 把西红柿纵向切成两半。

entry.def: If you cut yourself or cut a part of your body, you accidentally injure yourself on a sharp object so that you bleed.

example.ex: Johnson cut himself shaving...
example.tran: 约翰逊刮胡子时刮伤了自己。

example.ex: I started to cry because I cut my finger...
example.tran: 我因为割破手指哭了起来。

entry.def: If you cut something such as grass, your hair, or your fingernails, you shorten them using scissors or another tool.

example.ex: The most recent tenants hadn't even cut the grass...
example.tran: 上一拨房客连草都没有修剪。

example.ex: You have to learn not to cut your toenails in the living room...
example.tran: 你要知道不可以在起居室里剪脚趾甲。

entry.def: The way that clothes are cut is the way they are designed and made.

example.ex: ...badly cut blue suits.
example.tran: 剪裁得很差劲的蓝色套装

entry.def: To cut through something means to move or pass through it easily.

example.ex: I could see long canoes cutting through the waves.
example.tran: 我看见长长的独木舟破浪而行。

entry.def: If you cut across or through a place, you go through it because it is the shortest route to another place.

example.ex: He decided to cut across the Heath, through Greenwich Park.
example.tran: 他决定抄近路走格林尼治公园穿过希思区。

entry.def: If you cut something, you reduce it.

example.ex: The first priority is to cut costs...
example.tran: 当务之急是降低成本。

example.ex: The UN force is to be cut by 90%.
example.tran: 联合国部队将裁减90%。

entry.def: If you cut a text, broadcast, or performance, you shorten it. If you cut a part of a text, broadcast, or performance, you do not publish, broadcast, or perform that part.

example.ex: Branagh has cut the play judiciously...
example.tran: 布拉纳对这部剧进行了高明的删改。

example.ex: The audience wants more music and less drama, so we've cut some scenes.
example.tran: 观众想要多一些音乐，少一些表演，所以我们删掉了一些场景。

entry.def: To cut a supply of something means to stop providing it or stop it being provided.

example.ex: They used pressure tactics to force them to return, including cutting food and water supplies.
example.tran: 他们采用施加压力的策略迫使他们回来，包括切断食物和水的供应。

entry.def: If you cut a pack of playing cards, you divide it into two.

example.ex: Place the cards face down on the table and cut them.
example.tran: 把纸牌正面朝下放在桌子上，然后切牌。

entry.tran: 停(电影导演要求停止拍摄时的用语)
entry.def: When the director of a film says 'cut', they want the actors and the camera crew to stop filming.

entry.tran: 灌制(唱片);制作(激光唱片)
entry.def: When a singer or band cuts a CD, they make a recording of their music.

example.ex: She eventually cut her own album.
example.tran: 她终于录制了自己的专辑。

entry.def: When a child cuts a tooth, a new tooth starts to grow through the gum.

example.ex: Many infants do not cut their first tooth until they are a year old.
example.tran: 很多婴儿到一岁大时才开始长牙。

entry.def: If a child cuts classes or cuts school, they do not go to classes or to school when they are supposed to.

example.ex: Cutting school more than once in three months is a sign of trouble.
example.tran: 3个月内旷课次数超过一次就可能有麻烦了。

entry.tran: (不耐烦地让人停止做某事)别…，不要…
entry.def: If you tell someone to cut something, you are telling them in an irritated way to stop it.

example.ex: 'Cut the euphemisms, Daniel,' Brenda snapped...
example.tran: “丹尼尔，别绕弯子了，”布伦达厉声说道。

example.ex: Why don't you just cut the crap and open the door.
example.tran: 你为什么不能停止废话去把门打开。

entry.tran: (从动物躯体上)割下的一块肉
entry.def: A cut of meat is a piece or type of meat which is cut in a particular way from the animal, or from a particular part of it.

example.ex: Use a cheap cut such as spare rib chops.
example.tran: 用一块便宜点的肉，比如肋排肉。

entry.tran: (尤指通过不诚实手段获得的)份，份额
entry.def: Someone's cut of the profits or winnings from something, especially ones that have been obtained dishonestly, is their share.

example.ex: The lawyers, of course, take their cut of the little guy's winnings.
example.tran: 律师们自然从那个小家伙赢得的钱中分到了他们的一份。

entry.tran: (在山中开凿的公路或铁路)通道，路堑
entry.def: A cut is a narrow valley which has been cut through a hill so that a road or railroad track can pass through.
If you say that someone or something is a cut above other people or things of the same kind, you mean they are better than them.

example.ex: Joan Smith's detective stories are a cut above the rest.
example.tran: 琼·史密斯的侦探小说比其他侦探小说都要出色。

entry.def: If you see someone you know and cut them dead, you ignore them.

entry.tran: 已成定局的;板上钉钉的
entry.def: If you say that a situation or solution is cut and dried, you mean that it is clear and definite.

example.ex: Unfortunately, things cannot be as cut and dried as many people would like...
example.tran: 不幸的是，事情并不像很多人希望的那样确定。

example.ex: We are aiming for guidelines, not cut-and-dried answers.
example.tran: 我们想要的是指导原则，不是固定的答案。

entry.def: If a person or an organization cuts loose or is cut loose, they become free from the influence or authority of other people.

example.ex: He's cut loose from this business except, possibly, where James is concerned...
example.tran: 可能除了詹姆斯外，公司里都没人能管得了他。

example.ex: It's about to be cut loose from the state on which it has so long depended.
example.tran: 它将脱离长期依附的国家，实现独立自主。

entry.def: If someone cuts and runs in a difficult situation, they try to escape from it quickly and gain an advantage for themselves, rather than deal with the situation in a responsible way.

example.ex: ...his cowardly decision to cut and run.
example.tran: 他作出逃跑的懦弱决定

entry.def: If you say that someone can't cut it, you mean that they do not have the qualities needed to do a task or cope with a situation.

example.ex: He doesn't think English-born players can cut it abroad.
example.tran: 他认为出生于英格兰的选手在国外不会取得好成绩。

entry.def: If you talk about the cut and thrust of an activity, you are talking about the aspects of it that make it exciting and challenging.

example.ex: ...cut-and-thrust debate between two declared adversaries.
example.tran: 公然对立的两个对手之间的激烈辩论

entry.tran: 有利有弊;两面都行得通
entry.def: If you say that something cuts both ways, you mean that it can have two opposite effects, or can have both good and bad effects.

example.ex: This publicity cuts both ways. It focuses on us as well as on them.
example.tran: 这种宣传有利也有弊。它使得人们关注我们，同样也关注了他们。

entry.def: To cut off a supply of something means to stop providing it or stop it being provided.

example.ex: The rebels have cut off electricity from the capital...
example.tran: 叛军已经切断了来自首都的供电。

example.ex: His company is preparing to shut down in the event that their water supply is cut off...
example.tran: 假如供水被切断，他所在的公司就准备关闭。

entry.def: If you get cut off when you are on the telephone, the line is suddenly disconnected and you can no longer speak to the other person.

example.ex: When you do get through, you've got to say your piece quickly before you get cut off...
example.tran: 电话接通后，你最好在断线之前尽快把话说完。

example.ex: I'm going to cut you off now because we've got lots of callers waiting.
example.tran: 就谈到这里好吗，因为我们还有很多打来电话的人在等着呢。

entry.def: If you cut someone off when they are speaking, you interrupt them and stop them from speaking.

example.ex: 'But, sir, I'm under orders to —' Clark cut him off. 'Don't argue with me.'
example.tran: “但是，先生，我是奉命——”克拉克打断他说道：“别跟我争辩。”

means.word_mean: 1. the act of reducing the amount or number;

sentences.sentence: "the mayor proposed extensive cuts in the city budget"

means.word_mean: 2. a wound made by cutting;

sentences.sentence: "he put a bandage over the cut"

means.word_mean: 3. a piece of meat that has been cut from an animal carcass
4. a distinct selection of music from a recording or a compact disc;

sentences.sentence: "he played the first cut on the cd"

means.word_mean: 5. the act of penetrating or opening open with a sharp edge;

sentences.sentence: "his cut in the lining revealed the hidden jewels"

means.word_mean: 6. a share of the profits;

sentences.sentence: "everyone got a cut of the earnings"

means.word_mean: 7. a step on some scale;

sentences.sentence: "he is a cut above the the rest"

means.word_mean: 8. a trench resembling a furrow that was made by erosion or excavation
9. (film) an immediate transition from one shot to the next;

sentences.sentence: "the cut from the accident scene to the hospital seemed too abrupt"

means.word_mean: 10. the act of cutting something into parts;

sentences.sentence: "his cutting of the cake made a terrible mess"

means.word_mean: 11. the omission that is made when an editorial change shortens a written passage;

sentences.sentence: "an editor's deletions frequently upset young authors"
"both parties agreed on the excision of the proposed clause"

means.word_mean: 12. the style in which a garment is cut;
13. the act of shortening something by cutting off the ends;

sentences.sentence: "the barber gave him a good cut"

means.word_mean: 14. in baseball; a batter's attempt to hit a pitched ball;

sentences.sentence: "he took a vicious cut at the ball"

means.word_mean: 15. a remark capable of wounding mentally;
16. a canal made by erosion or excavation
17. a refusal to recognize someone you know;
18. (sports) a stroke that puts reverse spin on the ball;

sentences.sentence: "cuts do not bother a good tennis player"

means.word_mean: 19. the division of a deck of cards before dealing;

sentences.sentence: "he insisted that we give him the last cut before every deal"
"the cutting of the cards soon became a ritual"

means.word_mean: 20. an unexcused absence from class;

sentences.sentence: "he was punished for taking too many cuts in his math class"

means.word_mean: 1. separate with or as if with an instrument;
2. cut down on; make a reduction in;

sentences.sentence: "The employer wants to cut back health benefits"

means.word_mean: 3. turn sharply; change direction abruptly;

sentences.sentence: "The car cut to the left at the intersection"

means.word_mean: 4. make an incision or separation;
5. discharge from a group;

sentences.sentence: "The coach cut two players from the team"

means.word_mean: 6. form by probing, penetrating, or digging;

sentences.sentence: "The sweat cut little rivulets into her face"

means.word_mean: 7. style and tailor in a certain fashion;
8. hit (a ball) with a spin so that it turns in the opposite direction;
9. make out and issue;

sentences.sentence: "Please make the check out to me"

means.word_mean: 10. cut and assemble the components of;
11. intentionally fail to attend;
12. informal: be able to manage or manage successfully;

sentences.sentence: "she could not cut the long days in the office"

means.word_mean: 13. give the appearance or impression of;
14. move (one's fist);

sentences.sentence: "his opponent cut upward toward his chin"

means.word_mean: 15. pass directly and often in haste;

sentences.sentence: "We cut through the neighbor's yard to get home sooner"

means.word_mean: 16. pass through or across;
17. make an abrupt change of image or sound;
18. stop filming;
19. make a recording of;

sentences.sentence: "She cut all of her major titles again"

means.word_mean: 20. record a performance on (a medium);
21. create by duplicating data;
22. form or shape by cutting or incising;
23. perform or carry out;
24. function as a cutting instrument;
25. allow incision or separation;
26. divide a deck of cards at random into two parts to make selection difficult;

sentences.sentence: "She cut the deck for a long time"

means.word_mean: 27. cause to stop operating by disengaging a switch;
28. reap or harvest;
29. fell by sawing; hew;

sentences.sentence: "The Vietnamese cut a lot of timber while they occupied Cambodia"

means.word_mean: 30. penetrate injuriously;

sentences.sentence: "The glass from the shattered windshield cut into her forehead"

means.word_mean: 31. refuse to acknowledge;

sentences.sentence: "She cut him dead at the meeting"

means.word_mean: 32. shorten as if by severing the edges or ends of;
33. weed out unwanted or unnecessary things;

sentences.sentence: "We had to lose weight, so we cut the sugar from our diet"

means.word_mean: 34. dissolve by breaking down the fat of;
35. have a reducing effect;
36. cease, stop;

sentences.sentence: "We had to cut short the conversation"

means.word_mean: 37. reduce in scope while retaining essential elements;
38. lessen the strength or flavor of a solution or mixture;
39. have grow through the gums;
40. grow through the gums;
41. cut off the testicles (of male animals such as horses);
1. separated into parts or laid open or penetrated with a sharp edge or instrument;
2. fashioned or shaped by cutting;
3. with parts removed;
4. made neat and tidy by trimming;
5. (used of grass or vegetation) cut down with a hand implement or machine;
6. (of pages of a book) having the folds of the leaves trimmed or slit;
7. (of a male animal) having the testicles removed;
8. having a long rip or tear;
9. wounded by cutting deeply;

sentences.sentence: "got a gashed arm in a knife fight"
"had a slashed cheek from the broken glass"

means.word_mean: 10. cut down;
11. (used of rates or prices) reduced usually sharply;
12. mixed with water;

list.explanation: (常用于否定句)有能力完成某事的

example.en: He is not able to cut his responsibilities like we thought.
example.zh: 如我们所料，他没有能力完成他的职责。

example.en: Do you think you're able to cut it?
example.zh: 你觉得你能完成这亊吗？

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)(聚会)瓜分掠夺物、分赃

example.en: All the gangsters will gather at their lair for cutting up the touches today.
example.zh: 今天所有匪徒都将在匪巢集合分赃。

example.en: The widow cuts up the pipes about her dead husband.
example.zh: 那寡妇在怀念她死去的丈夫。

example.en: I don't intend to cut up the jackpots.
example.zh: 我并不想无所事事地闲聊。

list.explanation: (对某人)没有影响、不起作用，说服不了(某人)，不能使(某人)相信、信服

example.en: I don't care who you are. It cuts no ice with me.
example.zh: 我不管你是谁。这与我无关。

example.en: Cut the comedy and get to work !
example.zh: 别再开玩笑啦，开始工作吧!

example.en: "I'll cut the comedy with you,"he said.
example.zh: 他说:"我不再跟你开玩笑了。"

list.explanation: 走捷径做事，用简便办法或省力方法做事(为节省时间或金钱)

example.en: They're always finding ways to cut corners.
example.zh: 他们总是找办法走捷径。

example.en: I won't cut corners just to save money. I put quality first.
example.zh: 我不愿意为了省钱而简单从事。我把质量放在首位。

list.explanation: [警察和军队用语]向某人颁发官方文件或命令(如委任状、搜查证、逮捕令等)

auth_sentence.content: Does it cut the mustard alongside the original NEU!
auth_sentence.res_content: Does it cut the mustard alongside the original NEU!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Does it cut the mustard alongside the original NEU!

auth_sentence.content: Cut the lobster in half using a sharp knife.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cut the lobster in half using a sharp knife.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cut the lobster in half using a sharp knife.

auth_sentence.content: Huge amounts of trees are cut down and exported.
auth_sentence.res_content: Huge amounts of trees are cut down and exported.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Huge amounts of trees are cut down and exported.

means.word_mean: 切, 剪, 割, 削; （从某物上）切下; 将（某物）切开（或分割）

sentences.en: A freshly baked cake doesn't cut easily.
sentences.cn: 刚烤好的蛋糕不容易切。

sentences.en: I cut you a piece of meat.
Ade cut a slice of bread for me.

sentences.cn: 我们要把草坪贴地修齐。

means.word_mean: 削减

sentences.en: We mustn't cut the cost of education.
sentences.cn: 我们不应该削减教育经费。

means.word_mean: 使(某人)感到疼痛或痛苦

sentences.en: What she said cut me terribly.
sentences.cn: 她说的话使我非常难受。

means.word_mean: (直线)与(另一条直线)相交

sentences.en: The line cuts the circle at two points.
sentences.cn: 一条直线与圆相交于两点。

means.word_mean: 裁剪样式

sentences.en: I don't like the cut of his new suit.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢他这套西装的样式。

means.word_mean: 伤感情的话或行为

sentences.en: That was a cut at me.

jushi.english: The tailor cuts with her left hand.
This cloth is too narrow to cut well.
jushi.chinese: 这块布料太窄,不易裁成所需的样式。
